default: (a) a {@item mace|phb} or (b) a {@item warhammer|phb} (if {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient})
(a) {@item scale mail|phb}, (b) {@item leather armor|phb}, or (c) {@item chain mail|phb} (if {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient})
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
A {@item shield|phb} and a {@item holy symbol|phb}

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells through prayer and meditation. The information below details how you use those rules with Cleric spells, which appear on the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir} later in the class's description.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know three cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.
Whenever you gain a Cleric level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

When you reach Cleric levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Cleric Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Cleric Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the {@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Cleric levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Cleric Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Cleric spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Cleric, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Cleric feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Cleric spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Cleric spells for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Cleric spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus.
entries: You can use a {@item holy symbol|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

classFeature.name: Divine Order
entries: You have dedicated yourself to one of the following sacred roles of your choice.

items.name: Protector.
items.entry: Trained for battle, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with Martial weapons and training with Heavy armor.

items.name: Thaumaturge.
items.entry: You know one extra cantrip from the Cleric spell list. In addition, your mystical connection to the divine gives you a bonus to your Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You can channel divine energy directly from the Outer Planes to fuel magical effects. You start with three such effects: Divine Spark, Turn Undead and Harness Divine Power, each of which is described below. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, choose which Channel Divinity effect from this class to create. You gain additional effect options at higher Cleric levels.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Cleric levels, as shown in the Channel Divinity column of the Cleric Features table.
If a Channel Divinity effect requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

items.name: Divine Spark.
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, you point your Holy Symbol at another creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself and focus divine energy at it. Roll {@dice 2d8} and add your Cleric level and your Wisdom modifier. You either restore Hit Points to the creature equal to that total or force the creature to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice) equal to that total. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage (round down).

items.name: Turn Undead.
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, you present your Holy Symbol and censure Undead creatures. Each Undead of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If the creature fails its save, it has the Frightened and Incapacitated conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

items.name: Harness Divine Power.
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you touch your holy symbol, utter a prayer, and regain one expended spell slot, the level of which can be no higher than half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (rounded up). The number of times you can use this feature is based on the level you've reached in this class: 2nd level, once; 6th level, twice; and 18th level, thrice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Divine Domain
entries: Choose one domain related to your deity from the list of available domains. Each domain is detailed in their own feature, and each one provides examples of gods associated with it. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features when you choose it at 3rd level. It also grants you additional ways to use Channel Divinity when you gain that feature at 3rd level, and additional benefits at 6th, 8th, and 17th levels.

entries.name: Domain Spells
entries: Each domain has a list of spells—its domain spells—that you gain at the cleric levels noted in the domain description. Once you gain a domain spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a domain spell that doesn't appear on the cleric spell list, the spell is nonetheless a cleric spell for you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class's Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Sear Undead
entries: Whenever you use Turn Undead, you can roll a number of d8s equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of {@dice 1d8}) and add the rolls together. Each Undead that fails its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against that use of Turn Undead takes Radiant damage equal to the roll's total. This damage doesn't end the turn effect.

classFeature.name: Divine Domain feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

classFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: Divine power infuses you in battle. You gain one of the following options of your choice (if you get either option from a Cleric subclass in an older book, use only the option you choose for this feature).

items.name: Divine Strike.
items.entry: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} using a weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra {damage 1d8} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice). At your DM's discretion, you can replace one of these options with a different damage type appropriate for your cleric subclass.

items.name: Potent Spellcasting.
items.entry: Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any Cleric cantrip.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Divine Domain feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Divine Intervention
entries: You can call on your deity or pantheon to intervene on your behalf. As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, choose any Cleric spell of level 5 or lower that requires an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to cast. As part of the same action, you cast that spell without expending a spell slot or needing Material components. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Improved Blessed Strikes
entries: The option you chose for Blessed Strikes grows more powerful.

items.name: Divine Strike.
items.entry: The extra damage of your Divine Strike increases to {@damage 2d8}.

items.name: Potent Spellcasting.
items.entry: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can add your Wisdom modifier to one damage roll of that spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Divine Domain feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Greater Divine Intervention
entries: You are able to call on even more powerful divine intervention. When you use your Divine Intervention feature, you can select cleric spells up to 8th level. Additionally, you can select {@spell Wish|Ishiir} when you select a spell. If you do so, you can't use Divine Intervention again until you finish {@dice 2d4} {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests}. When you cast {@spell Wish|Ishiir} with this feature, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the stress caused by using Wish to do something other than casting a spell, other than the chance to lose the ability to cast the spell again.

subclassFeature.name: Ambition Domain
entries: "The worthy shall strive for greatness—supremacy in life leads to supremacy in the afterlife."

Bontu has fully embraced this dictum, and though she expends little effort in teaching it, she surely leads by example. Her viziers subtly plant the seeds that flower into the ambition the God-Pharaoh desires. Through insinuation, they remind acolytes and initiates alike that achieving one's place in the afterlife at the expense of others is not shameful, but is proof of the initiate's determination and drive. Nothing is more important than that drive, they suggest—not the bonds of a crop, not friendship or love. Not even devotion to a deity.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Ambition Domain Spells
rows: {@spell charm person|Ishiir}, {@spell expeditious retreat|Ishiir}, {@spell fortune's favor|Ishiir}, {@spell suggestion|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Warding Flare
entries: You can interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses. An attacker that can't be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to this feature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Reject Failure
entries: When you fail a D20 Test, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to reroll it and take the higher result.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Ambition
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion} {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. Additionally, you do not expend a use of your Channel Divinity on Reject Failure if the D20 test does not succeed after the reroll.

subclassFeature.name: Undeniable Ambition
entries: Also add your Wisdom modifier to the D20 test when you use Reject Failure. If you fail the D20 test, you can choose to use Reject Failure again immediately without a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, rerolling again and taking the highest result. You can only do so once per initial use of Reject Failure.

subclassFeature.name: Arcana Domain
entries: Magic is an energy that suffuses the multiverse and that fuels both destruction and creation. Gods of the Arcana domain know the secrets and potential of magic intimately. For some of these gods, magical knowledge is a great responsibility that comes with a special understanding of the nature of reality. Other gods of Arcana see magic as pure power, to be used as its wielder sees fit.

The gods of this domain are often associated with knowledge, as learning and arcane power tend to go hand-in-hand. In the Realms, deities of this domain include {@deity Azuth|Faerûnian|SCAG} and {@deity Mystra|Faerûnian|SCAG}, as well as {@deity Corellon|Dawn War|DMG} Larethian of the elven pantheon. In other worlds, this domain includes {@deity Hecate|Greek}, {@deity Math Mathonwy|Celtic}, and {@deity Isis|Egyptian}; the triple moon gods of {@deity Solinari|Dragonlance}, {@deity Lunitari|Dragonlance}, and {@deity Nuitari|Dragonlance} of Krynn; and {@deity Boccob|Greyhawk}, {@deity Vecna|Greyhawk}, and {@deity Wee Jas|Greyhawk} of Greyhawk.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

entries.caption: Arcana Domain Spells
rows: {@spell detect magic|Ishiir}, {@spell magic missile|Ishiir}, {@spell magic weapon|Ishiir}, {@spell Nystul's magic aura|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Initiate
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Arcana} skill, and you gain two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard (Ishiir)|level=0|source=Ishiir}. For you, these cantrips count as cleric cantrips.

Additionally, whenever you gain access to a new spell level of your domain spells, including at this level, you can exchange one domain spell from that spell level for another spell from the wizard spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Arcane Abjuration
entries: As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, you present your Holy Symbol and censure extraplanar creatures. Each celestial, elemental, fey, and fiend of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If the creature fails its save, it has the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} and {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} conditions for 1 minute. For that duration, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns. This effect ends early on the creature if it takes any damage, if you have the Incapacitated condition, or if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Breaker
entries: When you restore hit points to an ally with a spell of 1st level or higher, you can also end one spell of your choice on that creature. The level of the spell you end must be equal to or lower than the level of the spell slot you use to cast the healing spell.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Arcana
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to {@skill Arcana} {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Mastery
entries: You choose four spells from the Wizard spell list, one from each of the following levels: 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th. You add them to your list of domain spells. Like your other domain spells, they are always prepared and count as cleric spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Beauty Domain
entries: Beauty can both bend minds and inspire hearts. It is the force that compels others to lose control and give in to their impulses, but it can also awaken strength and determination to steel a forlorn heart.

Clerics of Beauty bring joy and hope to the world. They are the beacon of light that reminds us that some things are worth fighting for. They seek to bring peace and amity among the world's folk. They fight only when they must, and prefer to use their magic to end fights with as little bloodshed as possible.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Beauty's Refuge
entries: Your mere presence is enough to inspire hope and determination in others. When you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, up to 6 allies of your choice gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) plus twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rebuke the Defiler
entries: You gain the ability to rebuke those who lash out at your in violence.

As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you inflicts damage, you force that creature to make a Wisdom save. On a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it takes psychic damage equal to the damage dealt. On a successful save, it takes half that damage.

If the creature made multiple attacks, select one attack to determine the damage dealt. If the creature used one or more effects that damaged multiple targets, choose the damage take by one of those targets from one of the effects.

subclassFeature.name: Beauty's Elegance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two out of the follwing skills: in {@skill Deception}, {@skill Performance}, and {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Elegance
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}) check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Beauty
entries: You become an avatar of unearthly beauty. Your enemies attack with uncertainty, fearful of damaging the wondrous being they behold, while your magic draws upon your presence to augment its power.

As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, you can impose a penalty on a creature's attacks against you or on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against your spells and abilities. This benefit lasts until the end of the current turn The penalty equals your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).

subclassFeature.name: Darkness Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Darkness Domain Spells
rows: {@spell arms of hadar|Ishiir}, {@spell hex|Ishiir}, {@spell blindness/deafness|Ishiir}, {@spell darkness|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Child of Night
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 90 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, you increase its range by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shield of Ineffable Darkness
entries: You can invoke the power of darkness to punish anyone fool enough to harm you. As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when a creature you can see damages you, that creature has to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain one use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} and all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Shadow Spawn
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you envelope yourself in a coat of shadows for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} while you are in dim light or darkness. This benefit lasts for one minute or until you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. It is also suppressed until the end of your next turn if you are in bright light or you take radiant damage.

If you damage a creature that cannot see you with a spell or an attack while this effect is active on you, you can choose to deal maximum damage. You can do so only once per use of this Channel Divinity.

subclassFeature.name: Hungry Darkness
entries: Your Shield of Ineffable Darkness becomes more powerful. When you use it, you can select up to three additional, hostile creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. They have to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or become {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Darkness
entries: You gain strength from darkness. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you fade into the shadows. You regain hit points equal to your cleric level and gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage for one minute. In addition, while this duration lasts you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is in dim light or darkness. It ends early if you become {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or if you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Death Domain
entries: The Death domain is concerned with the forces that cause death, as well as the negative energy that gives rise to undead creatures. Deities such as {@deity Chemosh|Dragonlance}, {@deity Myrkul}, and {@deity Wee Jas|Greyhawk} are patrons of necromancers, death knights, liches, mummy lords, and vampires. Gods of the Death domain also embody murder ({@deity Anubis|Egyptian}, {@deity Bhaal}, and Pyremius), pain ({@deity Iuz|Greyhawk} or {@deity Loviatar}), disease or poison ({@deity Incabulos|Greyhawk}, {@deity Talona}, or {@deity Morgion|Dragonlance}), and the underworld ({@deity Hades|Greek} and {@deity Hel|Norse}).
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

entries.caption: Death Domain Spells
rows: {@spell false life|Ishiir}, {@spell ray of sickness|Ishiir}, {@spell blindness/deafness|Ishiir}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Reaper
entries: The cleric learns one {@filter necromancy cantrip|spells|level=0|school=N|source=Ishiir} of his or her choice from any spell list. When the cleric reduces a creature to 0 hit points with an effect that deals necrotic damage, it regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + half its cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Touch of Death
entries: The cleric can use Channel Divinity to destroy another creature's life force by touch.

When the cleric hits a creature with a weapon attack or deals necrotic damage to it with a spell, the cleric can use Channel Divinity to deal extra necrotic damage to the target. The damage equals 5 + twice his or her cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Inescapable End
entries: The cleric's ability to channel negative energy becomes more potent. Necrotic damage dealt by the character ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Death Mastery
entries: You choose four spells of the necromancy school from any spell list, one from each of the following levels: 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th. You add them to your list of domain spells. Like your other domain spells, they are always prepared and count as cleric spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Destruction Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Destruction Domain Spells
rows: {@spell inflict wounds|Ishiir}, {@spell wrathful smite|Ishiir}, {@spell enlarge/reduce|Ishiir}, {@spell shatter|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Appetite for Destruction
entries: Your destructive acts fuel further expressions of devastation. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to immediately make one weapon attack or cast a cantrip.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Sundering Invocation
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to channel destructive energy.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you touch a creature or a an unattended object within reach. A creature must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking 5 times your cleric level force damage on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and half as much on a successful one. An unattended object takes 5 times your cleric level force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. You can attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} in place of one of those attacks, if you have one summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Hand of Devastation
entries: Your spells deliver exceptional power. When you roll damage for a spell, you can reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Fate Domain
entries: Gods of fate perceive the future and how the choices mortals make drive them toward their destinies. Some deities consider the future preordained, while others understand the multiverse as a place of infinite possibility. Clerics who draw power from the forces of fate sometimes receive visions directly from their deity and receive fleeting omens of the future. They share impossible knowledge with their allies and prophesize their enemies' doom.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed on the Fate Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Fate Domain Spells
rows: {@spell dissonant whispers|Ishiir}, {@spell heroism|Ishiir}, {@spell see invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell fortune's favor|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Omens and Portents
entries: You can perceive signs of the future in everyday objects and events, such as flights of birds or ripples made in water by a thrown stone. You can cast the {@spell augury|Ishiir} spell without expending a spell slot and, when you cast the spell in this way, the spell has no verbal, somatic, or material components. Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

In addition, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, when you cast a divination spell that includes a chance the DM gives you no answer or a random reading—such as augury, commune, or divination—reduce that chance by 25 percent.

subclassFeature.name: Ties That Bind
entries: You can temporarily tie your fate to others. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch one object or creature and magically tie a strand of fate from yourself to it for 1 hour or until you use this feature again. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC to resist this effect. While the target is bound to you and on the same plane of existence as you, you can sense the direction to the target's location, and you know the direction of its movement if it is in motion.

In addition, once per turn when you cast a spell using a spell slot to deal damage or restore hit points to the target, roll a {@dice d6}, and the target receives extra damage or healing, respectively, equal to the number rolled.
You can use this feature's action a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Strands of Fate
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to see and manipulate the strands of fate that weave around other individuals. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can enter this state for up to 1 minute or until you lose your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} (as if you were concentrating on a spell). For the duration, whenever another creature you can see makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} or an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, you can use a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to give the roll {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Striking
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Your magic grants you a brief vision of the target's defenses. Until the end of your next turn, you gain one of the following effects of your choice:

items: The next time you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against the target, roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the total.

The next time the target must make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a spell you cast, the target must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the number rolled from the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.

entries: You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Visions of the Future
entries: Your knowledge of the future allows you to guide an individual to achieve their greatest possible success. You can cast the {@spell foresight|Ishiir} spell once without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Domain
entries: The gods of the forge are patrons of artisans who work with metal, from a humble blacksmith who keeps a village in horseshoes and plow blades to the mighty elf artisan whose diamond-tipped arrows of mithral have felled demon lords. The gods of the forge teach that, with patience and hard work, even the most intractable metal can be transformed from a lump of ore to a beautifully wrought object. Clerics of these deities search for objects lost to the forces of darkness, liberate mines overrun by orcs, and uncover rare and wondrous materials necessary to create potent magic items. Followers of these gods take great pride in their work, and they are willing to craft and use heavy armor and powerful weapons to protect them. Deities of this domain include {@deity Gond}, {@deity Reorx|Dragonlance}, {@deity Onatar|Eberron}, {@deity Moradin|Nonhuman}, {@deity Hephaestus|Greek}, and {@deity Goibhniu|Celtic}.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Forge Domain Spells
rows: {@spell identify|Ishiir}, {@spell searing smite|Ishiir}, {@spell heat metal|Ishiir}, {@spell magic weapon|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Forge
entries: You gain the ability to imbue magic into a weapon or armor. At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can touch one object that is a suit of armor or a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon}. Until the end of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or until you die, the object becomes a magic item, granting a +1 bonus to AC if it's armor or a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls if it's a weapon. These bonuses increases +2 once you reach level 11 in this class.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} and {@item weaponsmith's tools|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Artisan's Blessing
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to create simple items.

You conduct an hour-long ritual that crafts a nonmagical item that must include some metal: a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon}, a suit of armor, ten pieces of ammunition, a set of tools, or another metal object (see chapter 5, "Equipment," in the Player's Handbook for examples of these items). The creation is completed at the end of the hour, coalescing in an unoccupied space of your choice on a surface within 5 feet of you.

The thing you create can be something that is worth no more than 1500 gp. As part of this ritual, you must lay out metal, which can include coins, with a value equal to the creation. The metal irretrievably coalesces and transforms into the creation at the ritual's end, magically forming even nonmetal parts of the creation. The ritual can create a duplicate of a nonmagical item that contains metal, such as a key, if you possess the original during the ritual.
The item you are creating automatically has the masterwork property if it can have it.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Forge
entries: Your mastery of the forge grants you special abilities:

items: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.
While wearing heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

subclassFeature.name: Saint of Forge and Fire
entries: Your blessed affinity with fire and metal becomes more powerful:

items: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to fire damage.
You can now use your Blessing of the Forge feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and you regain all expended uses on a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Domain
entries: Gods of the grave watch over the line between life and death. To these deities, death and the afterlife are a foundational part of the multiverse. To desecrate the peace of the dead is an abomination. Deities of the grave include {@deity Kelemvor}, {@deity Wee Jas|Greyhawk}, the ancestral spirits of {@deity the Undying Court|Eberron}, {@deity Hades|Greek}, {@deity Anubis|Egyptian}, and {@deity Osiris|Egyptian}. Followers of these deities seek to put wandering spirits to rest, destroy the undead, and ease the suffering of the dying. Their magic also allows them to stave off death for a time, particularly for a person who still has some great work to accomplish in the world. This is a delay of death, not a denial of it, for death will eventually get its due.

entries.caption: Grave Domain Spells
rows: {@spell bane|Ishiir}, {@spell false life|Ishiir}, {@spell gentle repose|Ishiir}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement|Ishiir}

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Path to the Grave|Cleric|Ishiir|Grave|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Mortality
entries: You gain the ability to manipulate the line between life and death. When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell to a creature at 0 hit points, you instead use the highest number possible for each die.

In addition, you learn the {@spell spare the dying|Ishiir} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. For you, it has a range of 30 feet, and you can cast it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Grave
entries: You gain the ability to occasionally sense the presence of the undead, whose existence is an insult to the natural cycle of life. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can open your awareness to magically detect undead. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any undead within 60 feet of you that isn't behind total cover and that isn't protected from divination magic. This sense doesn't tell you anything about a creature's capabilities or identity.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Path to the Grave
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to mark another creature's life force for termination.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, cursing it until the end of your next turn. The next time you or an ally of yours hits the cursed creature with an attack, the creature has vulnerability to all of that attack's damage, and then the curse ends.

subclassFeature.name: Sentinel at Death's Door
entries: You gain the ability to impede death's progress. As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you suffers a critical hit, you can turn that hit into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Keeper of Souls
entries: You can seize a trace of vitality from a parting soul and use it to heal the living. When an enemy you can see dies within 60 feet of you, you or one creature of your choice that is within 60 feet of you regains hit points equal to the enemy's number of Hit Dice. You can use this feature only if you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. Once you use it, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Knowledge Domain
entries: The gods of knowledge—including {@deity Oghma}, {@deity Boccob|Greyhawk}, {@deity Gilean|Dragonlance}, {@deity Aureon|Eberron}, and {@deity Thoth|Egyptian}—value learning and understanding above all. Some teach that knowledge is to be gathered and shared in libraries and universities, or promote the practical knowledge of craft and invention. Some deities hoard knowledge and keep its secrets to themselves. And some promise their followers that they will gain tremendous power if they unlock the secrets of the multiverse. Followers of these gods study esoteric lore, collect old tomes, delve into the secret places of the earth, and learn all they can. Some gods of knowledge promote the practical knowledge of craft and invention, including smith deities like {@deity Gond}, {@deity Reorx|Dragonlance}, {@deity Onatar|Eberron}, {@deity Moradin|Nonhuman}, {@deity Hephaestus|Greek}, and {@deity Goibhniu|Celtic}.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages|Cleric|Ishiir|Knowledge|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Blessings of Knowledge
entries: You learn two languages of your choice. You also become {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.
Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses either of those skills.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to tap into a divine well of knowledge. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you choose one skill or tool. You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the chosen skill or tool until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Read Thoughts
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to read a creature's thoughts. You can then use your access to the creature's mind to command it.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If the creature succeeds on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can't use this feature on it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

If the creature fails its save, you can read its surface thoughts (those foremost in its mind, reflecting its current emotions and what it is actively thinking about) when it is within 60 feet of you. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

During that time, you can use your action to end this effect and cast the {@spell suggestion|Ishiir} spell on the creature without expending a spell slot. The target automatically fails its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Visions of the Past
entries: You can call up visions of the past that relate to an object you hold or your immediate surroundings. You spend at least 1 minute in meditation and prayer, then receive dreamlike, shadowy glimpses of recent events. You can meditate in this way for a number of minutes equal to your Wisdom score and must maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} during that time, as if you were casting a spell.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Object Reading
entries: Holding an object as you meditate, you can see visions of the object's previous owner. After meditating for 1 minute, you learn how the owner acquired and lost the object, as well as the most recent significant event involving the object and that owner. If the object was owned by another creature in the recent past (within a number of days equal to your Wisdom score), you can spend 1 additional minute for each owner to learn the same information about that creature.

entries.name: Area Reading
entries: As you meditate, you see visions of recent events in your immediate vicinity (a room, street, tunnel, clearing, or the like, up to a 50-foot cube), going back a number of days equal to your Wisdom score. For each minute you meditate, you learn about one significant event, beginning with the most recent. Significant events typically involve powerful emotions, such as battles and betrayals, marriages and murders, births and funerals. However, they might also include more mundane events that are nevertheless important in your current situation.

subclassFeature.name: Life Domain
entries: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy—one of the fundamental forces of the universe—that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need, and driving away the forces of death and undeath. Almost any non-evil deity can claim influence over this domain, particularly agricultural deities (such as {@deity Chauntea}, {@deity Arawai|Eberron}, and {@deity Demeter|Greek}), sun gods (such as {@deity Lathander}, {@deity Pelor|Greyhawk}, and {@deity Re-Horakhty|Egyptian}), gods of healing or endurance (such as {@deity Ilmater}, {@deity Mishakal|Dragonlance}, {@deity Apollo|Greek}, and {@deity Diancecht|Celtic}), and gods of home and community (such as {@deity Hestia|Greek}, {@deity Hathor|Egyptian}, and {@deity Boldrei|Eberron}).
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Life Domain Spells
rows: {@spell bless|Ishiir}, {@spell cure wounds|Ishiir}, {@spell lesser restoration|Ishiir}, {@spell spiritual weapon|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 × the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Preserve Life
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your cleric level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Healer
entries: The healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 × the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Healing
entries: When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring {@dice 2d6} hit points to a creature, you restore 12.
If the healing formula of the spell involves a static number (beside your spellcasting ability modifier), you increase that number by half, rounded down.

subclassFeature.name: Light Domain
entries: Gods of light—including {@deity Helm}, {@deity Lathander}, {@deity Pholtus|Greyhawk}, {@deity Branchala|Dragonlance}, {@deity the Silver Flame|Eberron}, {@deity Belenus|Celtic}, {@deity Apollo|Greek}, and {@deity Re-Horakhty|Egyptian}—promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Some of these gods are portrayed as the sun itself or as a charioteer who guides the sun across the sky. Others are tireless sentinels whose eyes pierce every shadow and see through every deception. Some are deities of beauty and artistry, who teach that art is a vehicle for the soul's improvement. Clerics of a god of light are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their gods' discerning vision, charged with chasing away lies and burning away darkness.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Light Domain Spells
rows: {@spell burning hands|Ishiir}, {@spell faerie fire|Ishiir}, {@spell flaming sphere|Ishiir}, {@spell scorching ray|Ishiir}
{@spell guardian of faith|Ishiir}, {@spell wall of fire|Ishiir}

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn|Cleric|Ishiir|Light|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: You gain the {@spell light|Ishiir} cantrip if you don't already know it. This cantrip doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Flare
entries: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of yourself makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, causing light to flare before it hits or misses.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to harness sunlight, banishing darkness and dealing radiant damage to your foes.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol, and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. A creature takes radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d10} + your cleric level on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Warding Flare
entries: You regain all expended uses of your Warding Flare when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
In addition, whenever you use Warding Flare, you can give the target of the triggering attack a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to {@dice 2d6} plus your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Corona of Light
entries: As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, you cause yourself to emit an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it (no action required). You emit Bright Light in a 60-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. Your enemies in the Bright Light have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against your Radiance of the Dawn and any spell that deals Fire or Radiant damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Moondancer Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Moondancer Domain Spells
rows: {@spell faerie fire|Ishiir}, {@spell heroism|Ishiir}, {@spell moonbeam|Ishiir}, {@spell spiritual weapon|Ishiir}
{@spell fount of moonlight|Ishiir}, {@spell freedom of movement|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Training in War and Dance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Performance} skill and one of the following: {@item elvish sword|Ishiir}, {@item greatsword|Ishiir}, {@item rapier|Ishiir}, {@item scimitar|Ishiir}, {@item shortsword|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Crescent Dance
entries: You can harness your connection to Vaeraustraee to emulate her warrior aspect, entering the Cresent Dance. To do so, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield. It graces you with supernatural speed, agility, and focus.

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to start the Crescent Dance, which lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, if you don medium or heavy armor or a shield. You can also dismiss the Crescent Dance at any time you choose (no action required).
While your Crescent Dance is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

You gain a bonus to any Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} you make to maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
If you currently have a {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} summoned via the spell of the same name and you move on your turn, you can move your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} the same distance.

entries: You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Dancer's Fervor
entries: You can spend one use of your Channel Divinity as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} you use to enter your Crescent Dance to enhance it further. Choose one of the following benefits. You gain the chosen benefit for the duration of your Crescent Dance.

entries.name: Dance Partner
entries: You can cast {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} if you know it, expending a spell slot as normal. If you do so, its damage die becomes a d12 and it critically hits on a 19 or 20.

entries.name: Grace
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Swiftness
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by an additional 10 feet and you don't provoke attacks of opportunity when you move out of an enemy's reach.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. You can attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} in place of one of those attacks, if you have one summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Sword Shield
entries: You have learned to fight with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} like a seamless unit, using it to attack as well as defend.

When a creature you can see hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} while your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} is within 5 ft of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to gain a +5 bonus to AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss you.
If the attack misses, you can make one weapon attack or melee spell attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} against the attacker as part of this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Nature Domain
entries: Gods of nature are as varied as the natural world itself, from inscrutable gods of the deep forests (such as {@deity Silvanus}, {@deity Obad-Hai|Greyhawk}, {@deity Chislev|Dragonlance}, {@deity Balinor|Eberron}, and {@deity Pan|Greek}) to friendly deities associated with particular springs and groves (such as {@deity Eldath}). Druids revere nature as a whole and might serve one of these deities, practicing mysterious rites and reciting all-but-forgotten prayers in their own secret tongue. But many of these gods have clerics as well, champions who take a more active role in advancing the interests of a particular nature god. These clerics might hunt the evil monstrosities that despoil the woodlands, bless the harvest of the faithful, or wither the crops of those who anger their gods.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Nature Domain Spells
rows: {@spell animal friendship|Ishiir}, {@spell speak with animals|Ishiir}, {@spell barkskin|Ishiir}, {@spell spike growth|Ishiir}

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants|Cleric|Ishiir|Nature|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of Nature
entries: You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. This cantrip doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Survival}.

Additionally, whenever you gain access to a new spell level of your domain spells, including at this level, you can exchange one domain spell from that spell level for another spell from the druid spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to charm animals and plants.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol and invoke the name of your deity. Each beast or plant creature that can see you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If the creature fails its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it is {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you for 1 minute or until it takes damage. While it is {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you, it is friendly to you and other creatures you designate.

subclassFeature.name: Dampen Elements
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to grant {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the creature against that instance of the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Nature
entries: You choose four spells from the Druid spell list, one from each of the following levels: 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th. You add them to your list of domain spells. Like your other domain spells, they are always prepared and count as cleric spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Order Domain
entries: The Order Domain represents discipline, as well as devotion to a society or an institution and strict obedience to the laws governing it. On Ravnica, the domain is favored by clerics of the Azorius Senate, who use it to maintain and enforce the law, and of the Orzhov Syndicate, who exploit law and order for their personal gain. On other worlds, gods who grant access to this domain include {@deity Bane}, {@deity Tyr}, {@deity Majere|Dragonlance}, {@deity Erathis|Dawn War|DMG}, {@deity Pholtus|Greyhawk}, {@deity Wee Jas|Greyhawk}, {@deity Aureon|Eberron}, {@deity Maglubiyet|Nonhuman}, {@deity Nuada|Celtic}, {@deity Athena|Greek}, {@deity Anubis|Egyptian}, {@deity Forseti|Norse}, and {@deity Asmodeus|Dawn War|DMG}.

The ideal of order is obedience to the law above all else, rather than to a specific individual or the passing influence of emotion or popular rule. Clerics of order are typically concerned with how things are done, rather than whether an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}'s results are just. Following the law and obeying its edicts is critical, especially when it benefits these clerics and their guilds or deities.

Law establishes hierarchies. Those selected by the law to lead must be obeyed. Those who obey must do so to the best of their ability. In this manner, law creates an intricate web of obligations that allows society to forge order and security in a chaotic multiverse.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Order Domain Spells
rows: {@spell command|Ishiir}, {@spell heroism|Ishiir}, {@spell hold person|Ishiir}, {@spell zone of truth|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Persuasion} skill (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Voice of Authority
entries: You can invoke the power of law to drive an ally to attack. If you cast a spell with a spell slot of 1st level or higher and target an ally with the spell, that ally can use their {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} immediately after the spell to make one weapon attack against a creature of your choice that you can see.
If the spell targets more than one ally, you choose the ally who can make the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Order's Demand
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to exert an intimidating presence over others.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol, and each creature of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you until the end of your next turn or until the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creature takes any damage. You can also cause any of the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creatures to drop what they are holding when they fail the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Embodiment of the Law
entries: You become remarkably adept at channeling magical energy to compel others.

If you cast a spell of the enchantment school using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can change the spell's casting time to 1 {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} for this casting, provided the spell's casting time is normally 1 action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Order's Wrath
entries: Enemies you designate for destruction wilt under the combined efforts of you and your allies. If you deal damage to a creature on your turn, you can curse that creature until the start of your next turn. When one of your allies hits the cursed creature with an attack, the target also takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage. You can curse a creature in this way only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Peace Domain
entries: The balm of peace thrives at the heart of healthy communities, between friendly nations, and in the souls of the kindhearted. The gods of peace inspire people of all sorts to resolve conflict and to stand up against those forces that try to prevent peace from flourishing. See the Peace Deities table for a list of some of the gods associated with this domain.

Clerics of the Peace Domain preside over the signing of treaties, and they are often asked to arbitrate in disputes. These clerics' blessings draw people together and help them shoulder one another's burdens, and the clerics' magic aids those who are driven to fight for the way of peace.

entries.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Peace Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Peace Domain Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity|Ishiir}, {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Peace
entries: You can conduct a magical ritual that wards off those that would do you and your companions harm. You have to spend 8 hours during downtime before a rest to prepare the ritual. You and your companions do not suffer a random combat encounter during the night. If a combat encounter happens through different circumstances, none of you can be surprised and are automatically woken at the start of combat.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Implement of Peace
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion} skill (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Balm of Peace
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to make your very presence a soothing balm. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, without provoking opportunity attacks, and when you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this action, you can restore a number of hit points to that creature equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). A creature can receive this healing only once whenever you take this action.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Tranquility
entries: You always have the {@spell Sanctuary|Ishiir} spell prepared.

As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you is targeted by an attack or other harmful effect, you can cast {@spell Sanctuary|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot, and you adopt a presence of tranquility for 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} ends. During this time, you can cast {@spell Sanctuary|Ishiir} again as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} without expending a spell slot.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Peace
entries: You radiate a soothing, unseeable aura in a 30-foot Emanation that originates from you. The aura is inactive while you have the {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} condition.

All allied creatures in the aura are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition. If a {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.
Any hostile creature in the aura that targets you or your allies with an attack or other harmful effect takes psychic damage equal to half your cleric level (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Protection Domain
entries: The protection domain is the purview of deities who charge their followers to shield the weak from the strong. The gods' faithful dwell in villages and towns on the borderlands, where they help bolster defenses and seek out evils to defeat. These gods believe that a strong shield and a suit of armor is the best defense against evil, second only to a stout mace on hand to respond to any attacks in kind. Deities who grant this domain include {@deity Helm}, {@deity Ilmater}, {@deity Torm}, {@deity Tyr}, {@deity Heironeous|Greyhawk}, {@deity St. Cuthbert|Greyhawk}, {@deity Paladine|Dragonlance}, {@deity Dol Dorn|Eberron}, {@deity the Silver Flame|Eberron}, {@deity Bahamut|Nonhuman}, {@deity Yondalla|Nonhuman}, {@deity Athena|Greek}, and {@deity Odin|Norse}.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Protection Domain Spells
rows: {@spell compelled duel|Ishiir}, {@spell protection from evil and good|Ishiir}, {@spell aid|Ishiir}, {@spell protection from poison|Ishiir}
{@spell guardian of faith|Ishiir}, {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Shield of the Faithful
entries: You always have the {@spell Shield of Faith|Ishiir} spell prepared.

You can cast it without {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} and without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all expended uses on {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also restore a use by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Radiant Defense
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to cloak your allies in radiant armor.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you channel blessed energy into an ally that you can see within 30 feet of you. The first time that ally is hit by an attack before you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, the attacker takes radiant damage equal to {@dice 2d10} + your cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Radiant Defense
entries: An ally affected by your Channel Divinity: Radiant Defense also has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against the damage of the triggering attack.

subclassFeature.name: Indomitable Defense
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to two damage types of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can change the damage types you chose.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can temporarily give up this {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and transfer it to one creature you touch. The creature keeps the {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} until the end of your next {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or until you transfer it back to yourself as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Solidarity Domain
entries: "The worthy must know and respect all others whom the God-Pharaoh deems worthy, for in the afterlife, all will be united in purpose and action."

Oketra is charged with expounding upon this teaching of the God-Pharaoh, instilling in every initiate the virtue of solidarity. She forges each group of children into a crop of acolytes with just one purpose: to be judged worthy of a glorious afterlife. And she instills in each crop the ability to unite in a single action in pursuit of that purpose. She is fond of poetic imagery to communicate her ideals.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Solidarity Domain Spells
rows: {@spell bless|Ishiir}, {@spell guiding bolt|Ishiir}, {@spell aid|Ishiir}, {@spell warding bond|Ishiir}
{@spell aura of life|Ishiir}, {@spell guardian of faith|Ishiir}
{@spell circle of power|Ishiir}, {@spell mass cure wounds|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Bonds of Solidarity
entries: You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. You create a magical bond among them for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again. While any bonded creature is within 30 feet of another, the creature can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} it makes. Each creature can add the d4 no more than once per turn.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a level 2+ spell slot to regain a use.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Power of Many
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to choose a different creature you can see within 30 feet of it or you and that isn't already targeted by the same effect to make the same {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} as well. The second creature is not subject to any effects from the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and the first creature can use its roll instead of its own if it is higher.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Bond
entries: The bond you forge between people helps them protect each other. When a creature affected by your Bonds of Solidarity feature is about to take damage, a second bonded creature within 30 feet of the first can use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the first creature. The second creature then takes all the damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Expansive Bond
entries: The benefits of your Bonds of Solidarity and Protective Bond features now work when the creatures are within 60 feet of each other. Moreover, when a creature uses Protective Bond to take someone else's damage, the creature has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Strength Domain
entries: "The worthy shall hone a strong body that can withstand the boundless energies of the afterlife."

It falls to Rhonas to instill this teaching in those who would enter the afterlife—but to his mind, the words themselves don't matter. Strength can't be taught. It must be built through practice and training. Rhonas demonstrates his teachings by his example, rather than by giving his students any kind of academic instruction. He welcomes the people of Naktamun to stand by the Hekma and watch him as he storms into the desert to battle the greatest horrors. He encourages them to observe his indomitable strength, for though they will never equal it, they can aspire to mimicry. He invites them to scrutinize every move and practice what they see.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Strength Domain Spells
rows: {@spell divine favor|Ishiir}, {@spell shield of faith|Ishiir}, {@spell enhance ability|Ishiir}, {@spell protection from poison|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of Strength
entries: You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Survival}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Feat of Strength
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to enhance your physical might. When you fail an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} using Strength, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. Alternatively, when a creature within 30 feet of you fails an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} using Strength, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fail.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. You can attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} in place of one of those attacks, if you have one summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Strength
entries: You count as one size larger for the purpose of grappling, shoving, and carrying. Additionally, when you make a Strength check, Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you add your Wisdom modifier to it.

subclassFeature.name: Tempest Domain
entries: Gods whose portfolios include the Tempest domain—including {@deity Talos}, {@deity Umberlee}, {@deity Kord|Greyhawk}, {@deity Zeboim|Dragonlance}, {@deity the Devourer|Eberron}, {@deity Zeus|Greek}, and {@deity Thor|Norse}—govern storms, sea, and sky. They include gods of lightning and thunder, gods of earthquakes, some fire gods, and certain gods of violence, physical strength, and courage. In some pantheons, a god of this domain rules over other deities and is known for swift justice delivered by thunderbolts. In the pantheons of seafaring people, gods of this domain are ocean deities and the patrons of sailors. Tempest gods send their clerics to inspire fear in the common folk, either to keep those folk on the path of righteousness or to encourage them to offer sacrifices of propitiation to ward off divine wrath.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Tempest Domain Spells
rows: {@spell fog cloud|Ishiir}, {@spell thunderwave|Ishiir}, {@spell gust of wind|Ishiir}, {@spell shatter|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Storm
entries: You can thunderously rebuke attackers. When a creature within 10 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cause the creature to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus lightning or thunder damage (your choice) on a failed {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, and half as much damage on a successful one.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to wield the power of the storm with unchecked ferocity.
When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderbolt Strike
entries: When you deal lightning or thunder damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your current {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} whenever you are not underground or indoors, and gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lighting and thunder damage.
Additionally, you regain all expended uses of your Wrath of the Storm subclass feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Trickery Domain
entries: Gods of trickery—such as {@deity Tymora}, {@deity Beshaba}, {@deity Olidammara|Greyhawk}, {@deity the Traveler|Eberron}, {@deity Garl Glittergold|Nonhuman}, and {@deity Loki|Norse}—are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. They're patrons of thieves, scoundrels, gamblers, rebels, and liberators. Their clerics are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, freeing captives, and flouting hollow traditions. They prefer subterfuge, pranks, deception, and theft rather than direct confrontation.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Trickery Domain Spells
rows: {@spell charm person|Ishiir}, {@spell disguise self|Ishiir}, {@spell invisibility|Ishiir}, {@spell pass without trace|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Trickster
entries: As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, you can choose yourself or a willing creature within 30 feet of yourself to have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity (Stealth) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.
