This blessing lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to create a perfect visual illusion of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself. The illusion is intangible and doesn't occupy its space. It lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} condition. The illusion is animated and mimics your expressions and gestures. While it persists, you gain the following benefits.

items.name: Cast Spells.
items.entry: You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses.

items.name: Distract.
items.entry: When both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against that creature, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is within 120 feet of yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Trickster's Transposition
entries: Whenever you take the {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to create or move the illusion of your Invoke Duplicity, you can teleport, swapping places with the illusion.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Duplicity
entries: The illusion of your Invoke Duplicity has grown more powerful in the following ways.

items.name: Shared Distraction.
items.entry: When you and your allies make {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against a creature within 5 feet of the illusion, the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

items.name: Healing Illusion.
items.entry: When the illusion ends, you or a creature of your choice within 5 feet of it regains a number of Hit Points equal to your Cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Domain
entries: The twilit transition from light into darkness often brings calm and even joy, as the day's labors end and the hours of rest begin. The darkness can also bring terrors, but the gods of twilight guard against the horrors of the night.

Clerics who serve these deities-examples of which appear on the Twilight Deities table-bring comfort to those who seek rest and protect them by venturing into the encroaching darkness to ensure that the dark is a comfort, not a terror.

entries.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Twilight Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Twilight Domain Spells
rows: {@spell faerie fire|Ishiir}, {@spell sleep|Ishiir}, {@spell moonbeam|Ishiir}, {@spell see invisibility|Ishiir}
{@spell aura of vitality|Ishiir}, {@spell Leomund's tiny hut|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Night
entries: You can see through the deepest gloom. You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 300 feet. In that radius, you can see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically share the {@sense darkvision} of this feature with willing creatures you can see within 10 feet of you, up to a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one creature). The shared {@sense darkvision} lasts for 1 hour. Once you share it, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you expend a spell slot of any level to share it again.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Blessing
entries: The night has taught you to be vigilant. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you give one creature you touch (including possibly yourself) {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the next initiative roll the creature makes. This benefit ends immediately after the roll or if you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Twilight Sanctuary
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to refresh your allies with soothing twilight.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol, and a sphere of twilight emanates from you. The sphere is centered on you, has a 30-foot radius, and is filled with dim light. The sphere moves with you, and it lasts for 1 minute or until you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or die. Whenever a creature (including you) ends its turn in the sphere, you can grant that creature one of these benefits:

items: You grant it temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your cleric level.
You end one effect on it causing it to be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Steps of Night
entries: You can draw on the mystical power of night to rise into the air. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} when you are in dim light or darkness, you can magically give yourself a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} for 1 minute. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Shroud
entries: The twilight that you summon offers a protective embrace: you and your allies have half cover while in the sphere created by your Twilight Sanctuary.

subclassFeature.name: War Domain
entries: War has many manifestations. It can make heroes of ordinary people. It can be desperate and horrific, with acts of cruelty and cowardice eclipsing instances of excellence and courage. In either case, the gods of war watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds. The clerics of such gods excel in battle, inspiring others to fight the good fight or offering acts of violence as prayers. Gods of war include champions of honor and chivalry (such as {@deity Torm}, {@deity Heironeous|Greyhawk}, and {@deity Kiri-Jolith|Dragonlance}) as well as gods of destruction and pillage (such as {@deity Erythnul|Greyhawk}, {@deity the Fury|Eberron}, {@deity Gruumsh|Nonhuman}, and {@deity Ares|Greek}) and gods of conquest and domination (such as {@deity Bane}, {@deity Hextor|Greyhawk}, and {@deity Maglubiyet|Nonhuman}). Other war gods (such as {@deity Tempus}, {@deity Nike|Greek}, and {@deity Nuada|Celtic}) take a more neutral stance, promoting war in all its manifestations and supporting warriors in any circumstance.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: War Domain Spells
rows: {@spell divine favor|Ishiir}, {@spell shield of faith|Ishiir}, {@spell magic weapon|Ishiir}, {@spell spiritual weapon|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: War Priest
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir}. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you misses with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity and give that roll a +10 bonus, potentially causing it to hit. When you use this feature to benefit another creature's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you must take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to do so.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. You can attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} in place of one of those attacks, if you have one summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Battle
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} condition and you gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Water Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Water Domain Spells
rows: {@spell create or destroy water|Ishiir}, {@spell fog cloud|Ishiir}, {@spell lesser restoration|Ishiir}, {@spell misty step|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Aquatic Blessing
entries: You can breathe underwater and you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. If you already have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir}, that {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} instead increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Nature} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Cleansing Current
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to summon a current of magical water to cleanse allies and wash away your foes.

The current rushes from your position in a line 15 ft wide and 30 ft long. You can end one disease or poison currently affecting any of your allies in the area of effect. If an ally is afflicted by multiple such effects, you choose which one to remove.

All hostile creatures in the area of effect have to make a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failure, they are pushed 10 ft away from you in a straight line and knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Riptide
entries: When one or more creatures have to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against one of your features or spells, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on that {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Saint of the Currents
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison and disease and you can walk on water as per the {@spell Water Walk|Ishiir} spell.

Additionally, all your water-based spells and your Channel Divinity: Cleaning Current have their area of affect doubled and you can choose to exempt a number of creatures equal to your WIS modifier from their effects.

subclassFeature.name: Winter Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Winter Domain Spells
rows: {@spell armor of agathys|Ishiir}, {@spell fog cloud|Ishiir}, {@spell rime's binding ice|Ishiir}, {@spell warding wind|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Winter's Touch
entries: You learn the {@spell Frostbite|Ishiir} cantrip. Additionally, you can start to use your control over cold to hamper your foes. Once per turn, when you damage one or more creatures with a weapon attack or a spell that does cold damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to reduce the movement {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of any of those creatures by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Bone-Chilling Cold
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to inflict your enemies with a deep, biting cold that cripples their ability to fight or cast spells.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you present your holy symbol and choose a number of creatures up to equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you can see within 30 feet of you. Each affected creature has to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. Any creature affected by your Winter's Touch class feature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.

On a failure, their movement {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is halved and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} for 1 minute. If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the creature completes the spell as normal. On a 10 or lower, the spell is lost. At the end of their turn, they can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success.
This feature has no effect on creatures that are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Hoarfrost Herald
entries: Your mastery of ice grants you special abilities:

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage.
You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and movement {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} reductions caused by cold, ice, and snow, whether mundane or magical.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Winter
entries: You master the cold element, to the point that you grow stronger as your foes succumb to the touch of ice and frost:

items: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to cold damage.

At the start of every one of your turns, you gain 5 temporary hit points for each creature within 30 feet of you that is affected by your Winter's Touch class feature or your Bone-Chilling Cold Channel Divinity. If a creature is affected by both, you double the temporary hit points gained for that creature. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour and do not stack with temporary hit points applied in this manner on subsequent rounds.

subclassFeature.name: Zeal Domain
entries: "The worthy shall rush to the God-Pharaoh's side with relentless zeal, rising to overcome every obstacle in their way."

The God-Pharaoh expects those he welcomes into the afterlife to desire it above all other pleasures and achievements, and for them to show their dedication, passion, and fervor through their actions. Hazoret is charged with cultivating this zeal in the initiates who come under her care, and she has undertaken the task with appropriate enthusiasm. She recognizes, however, that the best way to teach zeal is by demonstrating it.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Zeal Domain Spells
rows: {@spell searing smite|Ishiir}, {@spell zephyr strike|Ishiir}, {@spell magic weapon|Ishiir}, {@spell branding smite|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Ravaged Body
entries: You have a pool of power fueled by your zealous fervor that replenishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. The pool has a number of points equal to five times your Cleric level. You cannot benefit from this feature while you are wearing armor.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you draw power from the pool to give yourself Temporary Hit Points, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool.

You can also expend 5 points from the pool to remove the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} or {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} conditions from yourself, those points do not also give Temporary Hit Points.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you aren't wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Constitution and Wisdom modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Consuming Fervor
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to channel your zeal into unchecked ferocity.
When you roll fire or radiant damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. You can attack with your {@spell Spiritual Weapon|Ishiir} in place of one of those attacks, if you have one summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Blaze of Glory
entries: You can delay death for an instant to perform a final heroic act.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points by an attacker you can see, even if you would be killed outright, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to move up to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} toward the attacker and make one melee weapon attack against it, as long as the movement brings it within your reach. You make this attack with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}. If the attack hits, the creature takes an extra {@damage 5d10} fire damage and an extra {@damage 5d10} damage of the weapon's type. You then fall {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} and begin making death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} as normal, or you die if the damage you took would have killed you outright.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
